summary_points: 1. Johnson & Johnson reported first-quarter 2025 sales growth of 2.4% to $21.9 billion, with operational growth of 4.2% and adjusted operational growth of 3.3%.
2.  Diluted earnings per share (EPS) increased to $4.54 (including a reversal of special charges) and adjusted diluted EPS increased to $2.77, representing 2.2% growth compared to Q1 2024.

3. As of April 15, 2025, Johnson & Johnson increased its full-year 2025 operational sales guidance to reflect the Intra-Cellular Therapies acquisition, while maintaining its adjusted reported EPS outlook of 6.2% growth at the midpoint.

1. Henry Schein Inc. implemented a new Executive Severance Plan (effective April 10, 2025) and amended its Executive Change in Control Plan, providing severance benefits to certain executives but excluding the CEO.

2. The Severance Plan offers eligible executives a severance multiple of 1.5 times their base salary and average annual bonus over the preceding three years, while other participants receive a 1.0 multiple.

3. The Severance Plan includes restrictive covenants (confidentiality, non-competition, etc.) with potential forfeiture of benefits for violations, and is subject to the company's incentive compensation and Dodd-Frank clawback policies.
1. On April 9, 2025, Caterpillar Inc. appointed Joseph E. Creed as Chief Executive Officer, effective May 1, 2025, succeeding D. James Umpleby III, who will become Executive Chairman.
2.  Mr. Creed's annual salary will increase to $1,500,000, his target annual incentive plan award to 160% of base salary, and he will receive a long-term incentive grant valued at $5.5 million.
3. Mr. Umpleby's base salary will decrease to $1,200,000, and his target annual incentive plan award to 125% of base salary, effective May 1, 2025.
1. PNC Financial Services Group, Inc. reported first-quarter 2025 net income of $1.5 billion ($3.51 diluted EPS) on April 15, 2025.
2. Compared to the fourth quarter of 2024, total revenue decreased 2%, primarily due to fewer business days and a slowdown in capital markets activity.
3.  PNC expects second-quarter 2025 share repurchases to approximate recent quarterly averages, but this may change based on market conditions.
1. News Corp repurchased approximately US$660,921,865.91 worth of Class A and Class B shares as of April 14, 2025, under a US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
2.  On April 14, 2025,  21,536,129 Class A shares and 10,628,717 Class B shares were repurchased.
3.  News Corp's stock repurchase program intends to continue repurchasing shares of Class A and Class B common stock, subject to market conditions and other factors.
1. On April 14, 2025, Applied Materials Inc. acquired a 9% stake in BE Semiconductor Industries N.V. through market transactions.
2.  The acquisition is a strategic investment to further a collaboration on hybrid bonding technology for advanced semiconductor packaging, which began in 2020.
3. Applied Materials does not intend to seek board representation at Besi, nor does it plan to purchase additional shares.

1. As of April 14, 2025, Constellation Brands announced a change in senior management, with Paula Erickson replacing K. Kristann Carey as Executive Vice President and Chief Human Resources Officer, effective April 21, 2025.
2.  The SEC filing does not provide any meaningful numerical comparisons relevant to the company's financial performance.
3. K. Kristann Carey will depart the company in May 2025 after serving in an advisory capacity for a brief period to ensure a smooth transition.
1. On April 10, 2025, AutoZone Inc. entered into an underwriting agreement to issue and sell $500,000,000 of 5.125% senior notes due 2030.
2.  The sale of the notes was completed on April 14, 2025, at a purchase price of 99.334% of the principal amount, with an initial public offering price of 99.936% plus accrued interest.

3. The notes are senior unsecured debt obligations with customary covenants restricting AutoZone's ability to incur secured debt, enter into sale and leaseback transactions, or undertake significant mergers or asset sales.
1. West Pharmaceutical Services Inc.'s Senior Vice President and Chief Commercial Officer, Cindy Reiss-Clark, departed the company on April 9th, 2025, receiving a $699,526 severance package.
2.  Ms. Reiss-Clark's severance agreement includes a twelve-month non-compete and non-solicitation agreement.
3.  The SEC filing contains three photographs of Ms. Reiss-Clark.
